channel.title: Which anti bans?
channel.description:
I'm making a procedure called RABBIT, Random Anti-Ban Buried In Timer. Basically it works like a wait, except that you give it a range to wait and it picks a random time to wait in that range. And instead of just waiting, it randomly picks stuff to do while its waiting from a list. That list contains, you guessed it, anti ban procedures. What should the list contain? Here's what I have so far:
HoverSkill Leave Screen Pickup Mouse RandomClick RandomRightClick --RotateScreen--not sure about this one Type something then backspace it---replaces random chat RandomMouseMovement CheckWhichFriendsOnline ChangeRunModeAndChangeBack CheckWhichQuestsIveDone ExamineSomethingInInventory
What else do you humans do? lol

item.title: Which anti bans?
item.dc:creator: @Weibs Weibs
item.description:
@Weibs wrote:

I was wonderin how you use MarkTime(). Tell me if I’m wrong…

[scar]Program New;

var
MT1: Extended;

begin
MarkTime(MT1);
Repeat
DoThis;
BlahBlah;
Until(TimeFromMark(MT1)>2000);
end.[/scar]

I’m pretty sure I got something wrong, its something like that, isn’t it?

Read full topic

item.title: Which anti bans?
item.dc:creator: @Cheesehunk Cheesehunk
item.description:
@Cheesehunk wrote:

My AntiBan (Doesn’t rotate screen, I use BoredWhileFlagDist(distance : integer); (Check SRL\SRL\extended\xMapWalk.scar for it):

[scar]//****************************************************************************//

Procedure RClickExamine;
begin
MMouse(Random(MSX2), Random(MSY2), 0, 0);
If IsUpText(‘opti’) then
begin
GetMousePos(x,y);
Mouse(x, y, 0, 0, False);
case Random(3) of
0: ChooseOption(x, y, ‘Examine’);
1: ChooseOption(x, y, ‘Cancel’);
2: MMouse(Random(MSX2), Random(MSY2), 0, 0);
end;
Wait(Random(50) + Random(50));
end;
end;

//****************************************************************************//

procedure PeeBreakEvery(mins : Integer);
var PeeMark: Integer;
begin
if ((TimeFromMark(PeeBreakMark) / 1000) / 60 >= mins) then
begin
MarkTime(PeeBreakMark);
MarkTime(PeeMark);
repeat
Wait(1);
FindNormalRandoms;
until ((TimeFromMark(PeeMark) >= 15000+Random(60000)) or (not(LoggedIn)))
end;
end;

//****************************************************************************//

procedure SetRunEvery(mins : integer; Run : Boolean);
begin
if ((TimeFromMark(RunMark) /1000) / 60 >= mins) then
begin
MarkTime(RunMark);
SetRun(Run);
end;
end;

//****************************************************************************//

procedure RandomAntiBanEvery(mins : Integer);
var PantiBan: integer;
UnRounded: Extended;
begin
if ((TimeFromMark(RandomAntiBanMark) /1000) / 60 >= mins) then
begin
MarkTime(RandomAntiBanMark);
UnRounded:=Random(30)+11 / 10;
PantiBan:=Round(UnRounded);
case Pantiban of
1: begin GameTab(12) RandomEmote; end;
2: GameTab(1+Random(12));
3: RClickExamine;
4: WWait(5000+Random(3000));
end;
end;
end;
//****************************************************************************//

Procedure CheeseBan;
begin
RandomChatEvery(8+random(10));
BoredEvery(10+random(10));
PickUpMouseEvery(5+random(10));
LeaveScreenEvery(5+random(5));
HoverEvery(25+random(20),‘random’);
RandomRClickEvery(15+random(5));
PeeBreakEvery(45+random(45));
SetRunEvery(20+random(10),True);
RandomAntiBanEvery(10+random(15));
end;[/scar]

You need some variables, and you need to SetUp your main loop so it will start the MarkTimes, if you need any help, just ask!

Read full topic

item.title: Which anti bans?
item.dc:creator: @Weibs Weibs
item.description:
@Weibs wrote:

Tested it out, got 18727 milleseconds. So about 19 seconds. Not sure if thats right, seems longer than it was. Anyways, I’d be glad to write a few of the procedures, just tell me what your invisioning the procedure to do and I’ll give it a go.

Read full topic

item.title: Which anti bans?
item.dc:creator: @Boreas Boreas
item.description:
@Boreas wrote:

Yea I made up a few on the list too. If anyone wants to write procedures that would be very helpful. The only thing is I need to know the maximum amount of milliseconds it could take.

Minitual that looks good, I’ll play with it later.

I tested RABBIT with a bunch of different waits and it seems to work fine. Probably tonight I’ll start working on the list. So far I did HoverSkill, the rest either don’t exist and need to be written from scratch or they do exist but have to be modified or configured.

Here’s a test script for finding the time a procedure takes.
[scar]program timer;
{.include srl\srl.scar}
var a, b : integer;

begin
SetupSRL;
activateclient;
a:= getsystemtime;
HoverSkill(‘random’,false); //Put procedure in here.
b:= getsystemtime;
writeln('it took ‘+ inttostr(b-a) + ’ milliseconds’);
end.[/scar]

Read full topic

item.title: Which anti bans?
item.dc:creator: @minitual minitual
item.description:
@minitual wrote:

Weibs:

I’m pretty sure there’s a procedure for examining something in your inventory, thats the only thing I can think of off the top of my head.

Couldn’t you do something like

ExamineRandItem;
var meh:integer;
begin
meh:=Random(28)
if(ExistItem(meh)) then
begin
ClickInvItem(meh);
ChooseOption(‘Examine’);
end;
end;

Yes, I know those aren’t the exact functions but I’m pretty sure it’s something like that.
ClickInvItem(

Read full topic

item.title: Which anti bans?
item.dc:creator: @Boreas Boreas
item.description:
@Boreas wrote:

I’m making a procedure called RABBIT, Random Anti-Ban Buried In Timer. Basically it works like a wait, except that you give it a range to wait and it picks a random time to wait in that range. And instead of just waiting, it randomly picks stuff to do while its waiting from a list. That list contains, you guessed it, anti ban procedures. What should the list contain? Here’s what I have so far:

HoverSkill
Leave Screen
Pickup Mouse
RandomClick
RandomRightClick
–RotateScreen–not sure about this one
Type something then backspace it—replaces random chat
RandomMouseMovement
CheckWhichFriendsOnline
ChangeRunModeAndChangeBack
CheckWhichQuestsIveDone
ExamineSomethingInInventory

What else do you humans do? lol
